title: MySQLLN()Function

metadata.description: Learn about MySQLLN()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return the natural logarithm of 2:
SELECT LN(2);

Definition and Usage
The LN() function returns the natural logarithm of a number.
Note:
See also the
LOG()
and
EXP()
functions.
Syntax
LN(
number
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
number
Required. A number. Must be 
    greater than 0
Technical Details
Works in:
From MySQL 4.0
More Examples
Example
Return the natural logarithm of 1:
SELECT LN(1);

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers MySQLLN()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use MySQLLN()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of MySQLLN()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
